website_summaries.verdict: Perfect for young readers, Detective Pikachu is a kid-focused puzzle-based story that will test their logic, while investing them in the creative and captivating Pokémon mysteries of Rhyme City.
pros: Test your detective skills by collecting clues and evidence
Easy Mode is available for the youngest players
cons: The difficulty level of this game is geared towards children, so older fans should skip it

customer_reviews.title: This is exactly what I was hoping it would be ...
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was hoping it would be. Its entertaining and not too punishing. I already play competitive games, and this is so much more relaxing for those nights when I'm just tired and don't want to compete. Pikachu as a gruff middle-aged man is hilarious; I really didn't see that coming!
customer_reviews.author: FitnessEnthusiast

customer_reviews.title: She loved it, and had no difficulties finishing it on ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my 7 year old. She loved it, and had no difficulties finishing it on her own. She's pretty good at games, but i was surprised she was able to complete it without any help. I guess that's great for her, maybe too easy for someone older?
customer_reviews.author: H B Wofsey

customer_reviews.title: Got This to Help Reading Issues
customer_reviews.text: I'm not personality playing the game, so I can't comment on the gameplay. I can say that I got this for my 7yo who hates reading and is having trouble with it and with remembering what he's read. He doesn't play for long, maybe half an hour, but he's never had a video game before. I wish he'd play more, I'm a gamer, but it is what it is. Que sera, sera. C'est la vie. Anyway, it's got him reading more, reading bigger words, and trying to remember what he's been reading so he can do the detective stuff. Goal accomplished. He even likes to tell us what's happening in the story after he's played a bit! Yay!
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea M.

customer_reviews.title: Funny but way too many cutscenes
customer_reviews.text: I understand that this game is geared towards a younger audience. But for someone over the age of most likely 7, it is hardly playable. There are way too many cutscenes. For about 30 minutes of gameplay, half of it is cutscenes. Long cutscenes. This game plays like Dora the Explorer. I thought this game was for a wider range audience but it seems like it was designed only for toddlers or small children. The only redeemable feature is pikachus older man voice.
customer_reviews.author: Anna S

customer_reviews.title: My daughter loves it
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves all things Pokémon. So I purchased this for her birthday. Best part about getting this game for her is that it makes her read. She is a little behind with that so anything that can grab her attention and want to read is a good thing.
customer_reviews.author: J. B.

customer_reviews.title: Cute, but pretty thin.
customer_reviews.text: I love a lot about this game. But the negatives are pretty severe. Most importantly, it’s too short and too easy. Even on “hard mode,” your handed all of the answers with no actual deduction of your own. The dialogue is pretty bad, also - probably bad translating. I recommend the game to anyone who loves Pokémon (especially if you love the earlier tv shows), but I do not recommend it to a gamer or even a Pokémon gamer.
customer_reviews.author: HLFLFE

customer_reviews.title: Most definitely a kids game
customer_reviews.text: I am a young adult who loves Pokemon so I decided to play this title. However, I traded it on after about a week of playing it as it holds your hand as a player too much and is obviously designed for a much younger audience. It is an entertaining game but for a much younger player base than me.
customer_reviews.author: Javier Brion

customer_reviews.title: Easy and enjoyable game. A good amount of reading and not for impatient kids.
customer_reviews.text: It's nice to have a different Pokemon game when you are not a Pokemon Trainer but just a normal person who sees Pokemon along people for everyday work. It had a simple and enjoyable story. Would love a sequel but please let Tim have a actual wardrobe :)
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Rather formulaic, but 9 year old loves it
customer_reviews.text: My son isn't great at video games, so we got him this one so he could feel successful, despite his poor skills. He is having a great time with it and rarely asks for any assistance, which is nice. Watching him play I don't think I would like it too much, lots of trial and error and doing the same talking/exploring in each scene. Well suited to younger players. Very cute.
customer_reviews.author: Jocelyn

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Excellent gameplay. Funny and easy if you know how to play games. I beat it and passed it on to my nine year old who enjoyed it and beat it with only coming ro me a few times for help. I like that you can chose wrong as many times as you like with no penalties. It helped me teach my daughter to figure it out herself
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: 5 Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great detective, point and click adventure game with a Pokemon twist. Reminded me of the Professor Layton or Hotel Dusk games from the original DS. Must own for fans of the genre or Pokemon fans in general!
customer_reviews.author: KiryuDojima

customer_reviews.title: Short game but lots of fun
customer_reviews.text: I haven't seen the movie, but I bought the game anyway. I wanted a game that was easier to play because I am always getting stuck on games. I really enjoyed the game so much that I was a bit when it ended, I never wanted it to end. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Janet_M

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Fun
customer_reviews.text: I haven't finished the game yet, but every time I pick it up, it puts a smile on my face. It's absurd, funny, charming; really just a great side adventure for the pokemon series. Also the voice acting is a nice departure from the norm of 3ds titles.
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: Very boring
customer_reviews.text: This game is hard to get through. It holds your hands through the entire thing and it felt more like a visual novel instead of a game. My little sister also found it very boring so I wouldn't recommend it as a children's game either.
customer_reviews.author: Maya

customer_reviews.title: My boys love it! Happy!!!
customer_reviews.text: My boys love it!!!! It’s a great game, especially if your kids are into Pokémon! It goes awesome with my son’s Pikachu DS as well.
customer_reviews.author: SassyAmazoner!

customer_reviews.title: Thank god it's not Hey You, Pikachu!
customer_reviews.text: Even cuter than expected. The game and puzzles are fairly simple, and I think it's perfect for children aged 7-12 years old. I'm waaaaay too old for this game, but it was a relaxing diversion from the more competitive game types that I usually play. I definitely enjoyed the light humor.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: It's a bit cliche here and there but that's the fun of it
customer_reviews.text: Im really enjoying this game so far. It's a bit cliche here and there but that's the fun of it. It's an easy game that makes you spell out the problem. Talking Detective Pikachu is very entertaining and "cute" too.
customer_reviews.author: Wishing Star

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Game..
customer_reviews.text: Very cute game! There are nine chapters in the game the only regret you have after playing is you wish it were longer. I definitely recommend this game very entertaining.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Berger

customer_reviews.title: Silly and fun
customer_reviews.text: Silly, fun, entertaining in a kid-friendly way. My kids loved it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time. My son loves Pokèmon everything, and this was a birthday gift he loved. Well worth the cost with hours and hours of play time. Keeps him entertained on long car rides etc.
customer_reviews.author: Slkupfer87

customer_reviews.title: Aimed towards a younger audience
customer_reviews.text: I should have expected this game to be very hand holding considering it's a pokemon game. Was hoping for a fun Pheonix Wright knock off. It's not quite there. If you've got a kid who enjoys puzzles and POkemon, I'd highly recommend this title for them.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Muldoon

customer_reviews.title: Fun & cute game
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 7yr old for her birthday and she LOVED it! Hoping for a sequel in the near future. Good for learning problem-solving skills and for burgeoning sleuths.
customer_reviews.author: Kiminy

customer_reviews.title: Really fun!
customer_reviews.text: Really loved the gameplay, a good spin off game to play if you like Pokemon. Also dad jokes Pikachu is best Pikachu
customer_reviews.author: yoda

customer_reviews.title: Easy, but fun
customer_reviews.text: This game isn’t going to challenge you. It’s not really deep or super engaging, but it tells an entertaining story and has fun characters. It definitely feels like it was made for younger kids, but any Pokémon fan can get their money’s worth.
customer_reviews.author: James Page

customer_reviews.title: not my type of game
customer_reviews.text: its a slow paced game but its entertaining enough. wouldn't get the 3ds version as there was an announcement for a switch version soon.
customer_reviews.author: Phriski

customer_reviews.title: Cute little game that will last a few hours for ...
customer_reviews.text: Cute little game that will last a few hours for the little ones. It's a game of deduction so a little bit too hard for my 7 year old right now.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this game for my 10yo son’s BDay since he has been begging for it for months now. He was super excited when he got this in the mail. When he opened it, he realized this was for systems in Malaysia and Saudi Arabia. If it wasn’t for WarioWare Gold, his birthday would have been ruined. I hope I get a refund. UPDATE: I just got an American version of the game from from a local store. The game is going well so far. Awaiting refund.
customer_reviews.author: John Carberry

customer_reviews.title: He already has two of the other pokemon games on his ds but he seems to enjoy this one even more
customer_reviews.text: Got this game for my younger brother and he loves it! He already has two of the other pokemon games on his ds but he seems to enjoy this one even more!
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Casual gaming with great animation
customer_reviews.text: Simple gameplay. Great story and designed for casual gamer. I enjoy the quality of the animation.
customer_reviews.author: Lena

customer_reviews.title: Yes!
customer_reviews.text: Simple fun game. It is liner in its game play. I like having a different way to experience Pokémon world.
customer_reviews.author: Discerning Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun, if not a little simple.
customer_reviews.text: As the title says, it's a fairly simple game, at least for someone older like myself. But don't get me wrong! It's a charming title that will last you a fair number of hours. Definitely worth picking up if you don't mind some reading and enjoy Pokémon.
customer_reviews.author: Mikusagi

customer_reviews.title: Kind of boring
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for myself, gave to my little brother. More fun for kids between the ages of 10 - 15, or for people who are really really really bored.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars

customer_reviews.title: Ok

customer_reviews.text: Seller shipped quickly. Cannot rate game as it was a present for my granddaughter.

customer_reviews.title: It is fun to help her solve the mysteries
customer_reviews.text: My 9 year old loves this game. It is fun to help her solve the mysteries.
customer_reviews.author: AidenNAddysMama

customer_reviews.title: Whatever remains...must be the truth
customer_reviews.text: This should put an end to the "video games as an art form" debate. I have stood on the floor in the Sistine Chapel and looked up, an experience I considered to be the pinnacle of understanding the depth of the human spirit. Until today, friends. Until today. The bond between one Tim Goodman and one Giant Detective Pikachu has redefined what it means to live, and indeed, what it means to love. Please excuse me as the raw emotion of this gripping narrative is still coursing through my veins. I'm going to turn out the lights, cradle my Giant Detective Pikachu amiibo and just BE for a few minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Nick C.

customer_reviews.title: Must have on pokemon collection
customer_reviews.text: Did not finish the game anyway it is fun to play and OMG the voice of the Pikachu is hilarious love that

customer_reviews.title: My daughter beat the game in less than 2 days ...
customer_reviews.text: My daughter beat the game in less than 2 days, she said the story was weird and didn't make sense... I guess looking at a pokemon that is working a human role wasn't weird enough...

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.title: Storyline is decent but overall very disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Honestly while the story is interesting and engaging it's super short, the quick time events are meh and the conflict never gets completely resolved. Which was super disappointing. This is my least favorite pokemon side game. I really was expecting more since it took so long to get released outside Japan.

customer_reviews.title: So lame.

product_meta.title: Detective Pikachu - Nintendo 3DS
product_meta.description: Crack the case in this new detective adventure game by interacting with a unique, fully-voiced Pikachu! As Tim Goodman, you'll partner with a self-proclaimed “great detective” Pikachu to solve strange occurrences all over Ryme City. Together you must investigate, take notes, and meet up with other Pokemon to unravel the city's greatest mysteries! Game in 2D.
feature_bullets: Crack the case in this new detective adventure game by interacting with a unique, fully-voiced Pikachu!
As Tim Goodman, you’ll partner with a self-proclaimed “great detective” Pikachu to solve strange occurrences all over Ryme City.
Together you must investigate, take notes, and meet up with other Pokémon to unravel the city’s greatest mysteries!
Tim is searching for his missing father in Ryme City, but instead encounters a witty, tough-talking Pikachu!
Along the way, experience over 150 fun-filled animated cutscenes starring this unique Pikachu, providing helpful hints or talking up a storm.
You can also tap the extra-large Detective Pikachu amiibo figure to access all cutscenes up until the current chapter played.

As you investigate crime scenes, gather testimonies, uncover information, and interact with Pokémon to solve cases. You’ll have to put your detective skills to the test to foil the mastermind behind the disturbances in Ryme City.
All in a day’s work for detective Pikachu!

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars422 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
